intro: Chrysocoma spicata, commonly known as the spiky chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and dense clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Chrysocoma spicata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
